title: enable user namespaces on docker-machine

docker-machine allows to pass additional arguments to dockerd via the EXTRA_ARGS variable.

title: Preparation for HA of the controller
body:
This PR is to prepare HA for the controller. The goal is not to make the controller able to be HA.

This PR treats only:
- controller-container has an index
- the port for each controller is unique
- active ack will be sent to the right controller
- Tids, generated by controller will be unique (All tids of controllerX are `tid % numberOfInvokers = x`
- Edit nginx.conf to loadbalance between controllers (if more than one controller is deployed)

title: Dusting
body:
Adding some missing tests for package and action entitlement as well as tests which cover the action/package implicit right inference.

Remove `apply()` idiom which converted some of our types to `String` in favor of an explicit `asString` method (not using `toString` since that may format types for printing instead of type conversion).

This is further dusting ahead of some changes to the object access model.

@nwspeete-ibm FYI.

title: Introduce fully qualified entity name type into common API handlers
body:
This is some requisite refactoring to remove some of the unnecessary abstractions in the controller (authorized route, and eventually the document factory). This is a semantic preserving light change.

It threads the `user` through the API handlers, and replaces ("namespace", name) with FullyQualifiedEntityName.

The second commit makes the return type of the delete confirmation more explicit.

@nwspeete-ibm FYI.

title: Add openwhisk home as the location to search for whisk property
body: If this function is called by the scala code under the directory or parent directory, we can look up the whisk.property file even recursively until we find it. However, if other repo directories like openwhisk-catalog and openwhisk-package-kafka, are saved in the same level as openwhisk, we will fail to find the whisk.property file under openwhisk, but the test cases located under openwhisk-catalog and openwhisk-package-kafka, still need to read from whisk.property. Currently, we have to load this file by explicitly loading the path of OPENWHISK_HOME in openwhisk-catalog or openwhisk-package-kafka. If we can provide the option to read from OPENWHISK_HOME in WhiskConfig.scala, we do not need to get the OPENWHISK_HOME variable each time it is in need of the test cases under other repo directories.

title: Refactoring the action API handler
body:
This pr refactors the action API handler and the entitlement provider:
- the action activation bits are factored into their own traits and enable mock testing of the "invoke action" functionality. It also makes invoking an action accessible from other API handlers that need to post activations.
- the entitlement checks to permit checking of quotas independent of resources.

title: Measure bytesize of strings as if encoded in UTF-8.
body:

Fixes #1543.

title: Generalization of the WIP API gateway controller route for supporting system packages as API handlers
body:
The API gateway experiment and controller changes in #1440 is an example of a more general pattern where we use whisk actions to extend the controller for experimental API changes without necessarily changing the controller. This pr generalizes the API gateway route handler so that 

1. system packages are self-encoding as "meta" api handlers (via an annotation on the package and an explicit mapping from http verbs to action names to invoke in response)
2. the subject making the activation request is subject to entitlemnt checks for activations (this is tantamount to limiting API requests from a single user)
3. invoking actions directly rather than posting to the controller REST interface
4. checking that meta packages exist and performing cursory sanity checks
5. tests

The commits are staged to build off of #1440, first the next 4 commits applying a series of enabling refactorings. The last commits apply the generalization described above.

labels.name: review
labels.description: Review for this PR has been requested and yet needs to be done.

title: Add the method to get the credentials as a json object
body:
Since we are going to add the credentials for message hub in the
vcap file, we expect the property "kafka_brokers_sasl" as a list.
That is the reason why we need to get the credentials as a json
object instead of a hashmap.

title: Issue 1577.2
body:
Adds rules API handler test for use of `_` in action and trigger name. Reject missing namespace from either.

The second commit is a proposed fix for #1577 that permits unqualified action/trigger names in rule API operations which I think we should reject. The last commit adds additional tests to assert that a namespace must be specified (`_` is permitted as with the other referenced entities in sequences and bindings).

title: make netcat wait for response from zookeeper before closing connection
body: we noticed on some systems nc returns immediately and does not wait for the "iamok" response before closing the connection. the `-q` param forces nc to wait for n seconds until it gets something on stdin.

title: Warn user when consul configuration fails.
body:
It may happen that we cannot read configuration from consul, in such
cases (server is down / unreachable / etc.) log a warning to inform the
user of the issue.

This happened to me on my first deployment, and I was startled at why
the controller was unable to pull its configuration from consul.

I have sent a signed CLA as is asked int CONTRIBUTING.md

title: Update NodeJS runtimes and packages to latest
body:
- Updates NodeJS6 to LTS for 6.x (today [6.9.1](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/doc/changelogs/CHANGELOG_V6.md#2016-10-19-version-691-boron-lts-thealphanerd))
- Updates NodeJS0.12 to 0.1.2.17 to pick up a [security fix](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/doc/changelogs/CHANGELOG_V012.md#2016-10-18-version-01217-maintenance-rvagg)  
- Updates NPM Packages to latest versions (for nodejs6)
- Add some popular NPM packages (for nodejs6)
  - winston (MIT)
  - underscore (MIT)
  - uuid (MIT)
  - validator (MIT)
  - redis (MIT)
  - marked (MIT)
  - glob (ISC)
- Pinned the versions of npm packages for that the proxy server since it was using "^x.x.x"
  - log4js needs to remain 0.x since 1.x doesn't support nodejs 0.12 and our proxy is share for now

title: Introduce --main flag
body:
Introduces a `--main` flag in the CLI for action creation and update.

For Java, the flag is required; the CLI no longer attempts to determine the action entry point by analyzing the JAR file, which was potentially slow and error prone.

Users can now also create multiple Java actions using the same JAR file but a different entry point.

Fixes #1018.
Fixes #1026.

For NodeJS, Swift, Python, the flag lets the user optionally chose an alternative entry point than `main`.

Fixes (most of) #47.
